segments.text: I glance at the woman, immersed in her chores, blissfully unaware of the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a routine moment, yet chaos is brewing just a few steps away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem so alive with mischief, like little fireflies in a dull room.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something almost poetic about their secretive mission for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the thought of the boy tumbling off that stool sends chills down my spine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman stands there, so calm, while water threatens to ruin everything at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel the weight of this reality; it won’t stay perfect for long.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside world is a garden of tranquility compared to the storm brewing here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost like watching a play unfold, where everyone has a role except for me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I desperately want to call out to them, to make them stop—but I stay quiet, like a ghost.
segments.speaker: PAR
